name: Jack Off Jill
description: '''Jack Off Jill''' was an American [[alternative rock]] band from [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]], founded in 1992 by vocalist [[Jessicka (singer)|Jessicka]], drummer Tenni Ah-Cha-Cha, bassist/keyboardist [[Robin Moulder|Agent Moulder]], and guitarist Michelle Inhell. Though these four women were the initial founders, nine members rotated through the group in its life-span, including [[Scott Putesky]], guitarist and co-founder of [[Marilyn Manson (band)|Marilyn Manson]]. The band lasted nine years, with only Jessicka and Moulder remaining throughout the initial run. The band reunited in 2015 for a number of shows, with Jessicka, Tenni, Inhell, and bassist [[Helen Storer]].
